revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Google |model=Fiber TV Box |revision=v1 (GFHD100) |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date=09/2012 |fcc_date=06/05/2012 |manuf_country= |is_manuf=No |manuf=Humax |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=set top box |fcc_id=O6ZGFHD100 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=3.34 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol=reverse |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM7358 |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Micron |fla1_model=NAND |ram1=1 GiB |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=DDR3 |ram1_num=8 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe (half), USB 2.0 |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Foxconn T77H365.00 |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (half) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43228 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Broadcom |eth_chip2_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags=bluetooth, HDMI in/out, AV out, SPDIF |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:1A:11 |oui_eth=00:1A:11 }} '''Google Fiber TV Box''' :[http://support.google.com/fiber/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=2597690 Support page]
It can probably be assumed this device uses MoCA for the Coaxial connection.
"GFHD100 CPU B/D REV:0.3" appears to be silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :The BCM43228+BCM20702 wireless module in this device is manufactured :by '''Samsung''' (per the silkscreened ''Samsung'' logo on it). :It would seem likely that this is a fully [[Broadcom]] powered device.
*[http://www.geektonic.com/2012/07/google-fiber-tvis-its-htpc-dna-sagetv.html This device is powered by SageTV] *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r2vns_SVl14 View of the interface in action]
Possible 00:1A:11 OUI (it's on the label in the FCC photos)
===News=== *[http://www.broadcom.com/blog/home-entertainment/humax-deploys-industrys-first-hd-satellite-boxes-designed-in-40-nm-powered-by-broadcom/ ''Humax Deploys Industryâ€™s First HD Satellite Boxes Designed in 40 nm, Powered by Broadcom''] *[http://www.broadcom.com/press/release.php?id=s650502 ''Broadcom Powers Humax's First 40nm High Definition Satellite Set-Top Boxes''] :CPU: [[Broadcom]] BCM7358 - HD Satellite STB SoC *[http://www.broadcom.com/press/release.php?id=s901015 ''Broadcom Powers First Ultra HD Android TV Set-top Box''] :CPU: [[Broadcom]] BCM7252 - Ultra HD Android TV STB SoC :Wi-Fi: [[Broadcom]] BCM43570 2x2 802.11ac, Bluetooth
